intro: Iocaulon pilosa, commonly known as the hairy leaved orchid, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its hairy foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in dry, coastal environments. Its unique appearance and ecological adaptations make it an important species in its native habitat. Iocaulon pilosa is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, where it plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
